original: FERNSTRÖM, Erik Ferdinand, Direktör, Stockholm, f Kopparbergs landsförs 20/8 88 av K E Fernström o Sofia Westgren, gm Edith Neijber. Falu hal. Anst St Kopparb Bergsl AB 03—10, korresp v Rydö o Hylte pappers- o cellul.fabr 10—14, försäljn.ch 15— 19. Eg fma i London ss ombud f Fiskeby, Skärblacka o Ljusfors pappersfabr i United Kingdom 19, gr Fernström & Co AB i Sthlm o Fernström Paper Co Newyork 20, gr o styr-, ordf Fernström Paper Mills Inc, Pomona, Kalif, 26, gr Protecto Products Co, Inc, Pomona, Kalif, 36, deläg Fernström Paper Co Pomona o San Francisco Kalif sed. 26, styr.-ordf o vkst dir Fernström & Co AB. Led U S Bureau of Standards, Washington. Resor: Tyskl, Engl, Frankr, USA, Canada, Mexico, Brasil, Uruguay, Argent, Chile, Peru, Columbia mfl.
translated: FERNSTRÖM, Erik Ferdinand, Director, Stockholm, b. in the parish of Kopparbergs on August 20, 1888, to parents K E Fernström and Sofia Westgren, married to Edith Neijber. Formerly employed at St Kopparb Bergsl AB from 1903 to 1910, corresponding for Rydö and Hylte paper and cellulose factory from 1910 to 1914, sales representative from 1915 to 1919. Established own company in London as agent for Fiskeby, Skärblacka, and Ljusfors paper factories in the United Kingdom in 1919. Established Fernström & Co AB in Stockholm and Fernström Paper Co in New York in 1920. Founded and chaired Fernström Paper Mills Inc in Pomona, California, in 1926. Established Protecto Products Co, Inc in Pomona, California, in 1936. Partial owner of Fernström Paper Co in Pomona and San Francisco, California, since 1926. Board chairman and managing director of Fernström & Co AB. Member of the U.S. Bureau of Standards, Washington. Travels: Germany, England, France, USA, Canada, Mexico, Brazil, Uruguay, Argentina, Chile, Peru, Colombia, and others.

worksFor.name: Rydö and Hylte paper and cellulose factory
